dt: {bc}to establish or bring about as if by force

dt.t: those limits {it}imposed{/it} by our own inadequacies

dt: {bc}to force into the company or on the attention of another
{bc}to arrange (type, pages, etc.) in the proper order for printing

et: Middle French {it}imposer{/it}, from Latin {it}imponere{/it}, literally, to put upon (perfect indicative {it}imposui{/it}), from {it}in-{/it} + {it}ponere{/it} to put {ma}{mat|position|}{/ma}
shortdef: to establish or apply by authority
to establish or bring about as if by force
to force into the company or on the attention of another

dt: {bc}to force other people to do what one wants

dt.t: She is always trying to {it}impose her will{/it} on other people.

shortdef: to force other people to do what one wants
